thread.title: Steve Smith Sr., Crockett Gillmore return to practice as 10 players sit out for Ravens
thread.title_full: Steve Smith Sr., Crockett Gillmore return to practice as 10 players sit out for Ravens

author: Jon Meoli
title: Steve Smith Sr., Crockett Gillmore return to practice as 10 players sit out for Ravens
text:
Steve Smith Sr., Crockett Gillmore return to practice as 10 other players sit out Crockett Gillmore and Steve Smith Sr. Patrick Smith / Getty Images 
Ravens tight end Crockett Gillmore is tackled by Cincinnati Bengals middle linebacker Rey Maualuga and outside linebacker Vincent Rey in the second quarter as Steve Smith Sr. looks on. 
Ravens tight end Crockett Gillmore is tackled by Cincinnati Bengals middle linebacker Rey Maualuga and outside linebacker Vincent Rey in the second quarter as Steve Smith Sr. looks on. (Patrick Smith / Getty Images) Jon Meoli Contact Reporter The Baltimore Sun Steve Smith Sr. and Crockett Gillmore returned, but 10 Ravens were missing from practice Wednesday. 
Even with the return of top wide receiver Steve Smith Sr. (microfractures in back) and tight end Crockett Gillmore (calf strain) to practice Wednesday, the Ravens' list of injury concerns still managed to grow as 10 players sat out. 
Gillmore came back after missing the past two games with a strained calf, but made a big impact before his injury with 151 yards and two touchdowns. Smith, the Ravens' leading receiver, suffered his back injury against the Steelers and has sat out since. 
Several top players, including running back Justin Forsett (ankle), outside linebacker Elvis Dumervil (groin) and cornerback Lardarius Webb (thigh), sat out with injuries suffered in Sundayâ€™s 33-30, overtime loss to the Cleveland Browns. 
Running back Lorenzo Taliaferro (foot) missed the game Sunday and continued to sit out Wednesday, while rookie wide receiver Darren Waller (concussion) was also absent Wednesday. 
Guard Marshal Yanda also sat out after being limited in one practice last week with an ankle injury, while wide receiver Chris Givens and safety Terrence Brooks sat out for unspecified reasons.
